articles.author: The Globe and Mail
articles.title: Alcoa CEO appeals to Trump administration to drop tariffs on Canadian aluminum imports
articles.description: Canada is by far the biggest foreign supplier to the U.S., accounting for 2.9 million tonnes a year
articles.content:
Open this photo in gallery: Alcoa's Becancour aluminum smelter is seen in Becancour, Que., on Feb. 10.Bernard Brault/Reuters
Alcoa Corp. chief executive William Oplinger is appealing to U.S. President Donald Trump to drop his aluminum tariffs on Cana... [3593 chars]

articles.author: CP24 Toronto
articles.title: talks with Japan as U.S. seeks deals
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday inserted himself directly into trade talks with Japanese officials, a sign of the high stakes for the United States after its tariffs rattled the economy and caused the administration to assure the public that it would quickly reach deals.
articles.content: U.S. President Donald Trump gestures to the crowd as he departs after welcoming the 2025 College Football National Champions, the Ohio State University football team, during an event on the South Lawn of the White House, Monday, April 14, 2025, in Wa... [7276 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Judge Warns Trump Officials of Contempt Charges Over Deportation Order Defiance
articles.description: A U.S. federal judge indicated that Trump administration officials might face criminal contempt charges for ignoring a court order halting deportations of alleged Venezuelan gang members. The administration has been criticized for potentially disobeying judicial orders, escalating tensions between the judicial and executive branches.
articles.content: A federal judge in Washington, D.C., has asserted the possibility of criminal contempt charges against Trump administration officials who disregarded a court order to stop the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members. The ruling emphasizes the ... [719 chars]

articles.title: Debate begins with party leaders laying out how they intend to negotiate with Trump
articles.description: OTTAWA — As the French language election debate got underway Wednesday night, the four main federal party leaders were asked to lay out policy priorities that have nothing with the United States.
articles.content:
OTTAWA — As the French language election debate got underway Wednesday night, the four main federal party leaders were asked to lay out policy priorities that have nothing with the United States.
